meanings.definition: A person who rewords or restates information in their own words.
meanings.sent1: The paraphraser helped me understand the story better.
meanings.sent2: The teacher is a skilled paraphraser when explaining complex topics.
meanings.sent3: The clever paraphraser put a new spin on the old tale.
meanings.sent4: She was a masterful paraphraser, weaving words like a skilled artist.
meanings.sent5: The paraphraser's job is to make information easier to grasp.

meanings.definition: To rephrase or restate information in a different way.
meanings.sent1: I needed to paraphrase the paragraph to make it clearer.
meanings.sent2: She always paraphrases my sentences to check for understanding.
meanings.sent3: The comedian tried to paraphrase the serious speech, but it just sounded silly.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a paraphraser, constantly rearranging thoughts like puzzle pieces.
meanings.sent5: Remember to paraphrase the text to avoid plagiarism.
